question: Who among the following was appointed as the secretary of Education for India in 1917 by British and was the first Muslim to get this appointment in India?
explanation: Inayatullah Khan Mashriqi was also known as Allama Mashriqi. He was the founder of the Khaksar movement in 1930. In the year 1917 (October) he was appointed under the secretary to the Government of India in the Education Department.
